document.docAuthor: Palacio, Edgard, Bordera, Santiago, Sääksjärvi, Ilari E. & Díaz, Francisco
document.docTitle: Clistopyga isayae Palacio & Bordera & Sääksjärvi & Díaz 2018
document.masterDocTitle: The Neotropical species of Clistopyga (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae, Pimplinae). Part II: the C. isayae species group, with the description of seven new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Neotropical species of Clistopyga (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae, Pimplinae). Part II: the C. isayae species group, with the description of seven new species

heading.emphasis:
Key to the species of the
C. isayae
species group (Females)

paragraph.keyLead:
1. Upper valve of ovipositor distinctly thickened apically ( Fig. 1B )...
C. crassicaudata Sääksjärvi, Bordera & Palacio
sp. nov.

- Upper valve of ovipositor in lateral view uniformly wide along their length, or with the apex slightly slender ( Figs 1A , 4F , 5F , 6F , 7F , 8F )........................................................................................... 2

2(1). Metapleuron and metasomal tergites entirely black ( Figs 5D, E ). Tergite I of metasoma 1.2–1.3 × as long as posteriorly broad ( Fig. 9C ). Epicnemial carina relatively strong, its dorsal end weakly curved backward, ending slightly above level of center of pronotum.................................................................. ..
C. nigriventris Palacio
sp. nov.

- Metapleuron and metasoma with variable colouration, never entirely black ( Figs 1A, B , 3C , 4D, E , 6D, E , 7D, E , 8D, E ). Tergite I of metasoma 1.4–1.6 × as long as posteriorly broad ( Figs 9B, 9D–F ). Epicnemial carina weak, its dorsal end straight, ending at or slightly below level of center of pronotum....................................................... 3

3(2). Ocular orbits entirely yellow or white ( Figs. 1A , 8A , 11E ). Mesosoma mostly yellow or white with black or brown coloured marks. Speculum yellow or whitish ( Figs 1A , 8D )............................................................ 4

- Ocular orbits widely interrupted posteriorly ( Figs 4A , 6A , 7A , 11D ). Mesosoma extensively reddish-brown with black or yellow marks. Speculum always reddish ( Figs 4D , 6D , 7D )...................................................... 5

4(3). Background colour of mesosoma white ( Fig. 1A ). Clypeus 1.8–1.9 × as broad as medially long; clypeal suture slightly curved, almost straight ( Fig. 8B ). Occipital carina present dorsally ( Fig. 11E )........
C. taironae Palacio, Bordera & Díaz
sp. nov.

- Background colour of mesosoma yellow ( Fig. 8D ). Clypeus 1.6 × as broad as medially long; clypeal suture strongly curved ( Fig. 3A ). Occipital carina absent dorsally...............................
C. isayae Díaz, Bordera & Palacio
sp. nov.

5(4). Occipital carina discernible ventrally ( Fig. 11D ). Subalar prominence densely punctate (at least 24 setiferous punctures) ( Fig. 11A ). Hind wing with abscissa of Cu 1 curved ( Fig. 7H ).......................
C. splendida Palacio & Bordera
sp. nov.

- Occipital carina completely absent ventrally. Subalar prominence sparsely punctate (at most about 17–18 setiferous punctures) ( Figs 11B, C ). Hind wing with abscissa of Cu 1 straight ( Figs 4H , 6H )........................................... 6

6(5). Mesopleuron and metapleuron entirely red. Mesoscutum with fine and sparse setiferous punctures ( Fig. 4D ). Clypeus about 1.64 × as broad as medially long. Malar space about as long as basal mandibular width ( Figs 4A, B ).................................................................................................. ..
C. kalima Palacio
sp. nov.

- Mesopleuron and metapleuron with extensive white areas. Mesoscutum with moderately long and sparse setiferous punctures ( Fig. 6D ). Clypeus about 1.80 × as broad as medially long. Malar space 0.76 × as long as basal mandibular width ( Figs 6A, B )...............................................................................
C. panchei Palacio
sp. nov.
